{"step_by_step_thinking": "The distal ureteral diameter is a measure of the size of the ureter at its end point. Reflux resolution after endoscopic injection is a clinical outcome that depends on various factors, including the severity of the reflux, the type of material injected, the technique used, and the individual patient's response. While the size of the ureter may influence the ease or difficulty of the procedure, it is not a direct predictor of the success of the procedure in resolving reflux. Therefore, it cannot be said definitively that the distal ureteral diameter can predict reflux resolution after endoscopic injection.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
